Description: The digital object identifier associated with the publication in the form of https://www.doi.org/{doi} to comply with CrossRef DOI display guidelines.
The name of the periodical publication in which the publication was published.
Examples: The New England Journal of Medicine

Description: The PubMed identifier associated with the publication.
Keywords associated with the publication. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Authors of the publication. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Examples: Dr. Sarah Johnson, Dr. Michael Lee, Prof. Amanda Carter

Description: Assay(s) associated with the publication. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Tumor type(s) associated with the publication. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Tissue type(s) associated with the publication. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
Whether there are non-monetary restrictions on accessing an the publication.
The denormalized manifest for publication submission.
Relevant grant number associated witht the publication's development. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.

A list of the dataset aliases (An alias of the dataset must be unique. Can be the GEO identifier such as GSE12345, or a DOI. No Greek Letters) associated with the publication. Multiple values permitted, comma separated.
A unique primary key that enables record updates using schematic.
